abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Protected Areas
            Management and Sustainable Use Project for Uganda were as
            follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory; GEO outcomes
            were moderately satisfactory; risk to development outcome
            was moderate; risk to GEO outcome was moderate; Bank
            performance was moderately unsatisfactory; and borrower
            performance was also moderately unsatisfactory. Some lessons
            learned includes: project design should have a robust
            assessment of the governance challenges and plan mitigation
            measures accordingly. Long-term engagement in the sector and
            consistency of the supervision team are assets in using
            adaptive management methods to resolve issues. A phased
            approach allowed for the implementing agencies to, first,
            build a basic operational capacity and, then to benefit more
            fully from substantial field investment was appropriate
            under the circumstances. Decentralized institutional support
            is critical when protecting a vulnerable natural and
            cultural resource base. In developing an environmental
            program, competing needs of ecosystems and commercial
            development need to be balanced.
